Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: paulplf
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large by European standards. The bath was nicely appointed (except there was no fan vent). The bed was among the most comfortable that we have found in our travels. While the location is superb, be prepared to hear some city noises throughout the night if you like to sleep with your windows open. Overall the hotel is a wonderful value. I would caution travelers in terms of the breakfast/dining. We found far better places to eat for far less just steps from the hotel. We did have one hiccup with the staff...but I would chalk that up to his having a bad day. Overall the staff could not have been more pleasant or helpful. We will definitely stay here again when we travel to Paris. And I would highly recomend walking down rue St. Roch. We had two wonderful dinners just minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jay & Kanye Would Approve”
Reviews.Author: Wandering E
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in a beautiful corner (probably superior) room overlooking the avenue outside. Hotel is perfectly located next to public transportation and within walking distance of many Paris' major tourist sites, particularly the art museums and the river. Room was well decorated, giving a sense of understated luxury. The staff was wonderful in every way, from taking care of us when we checked in early to helping us find various locations around the city, printing directions, giving restaurant recommendations and more. Classy place that makes you feel like a rock (rap!) star.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baci28
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris many times and tried various hotels we finally stumbled upon one of the best finds in Paris. It is a small, quality boutique hotel. If you prefer the large chains, then this is not for you but if you are looking for elegance and personised service make a booking. We have stayed several times and the location is superb. Walking distance to the major department stores, Opera Garnier and in the opposite direction to one of the interesting covered arcades "Passage Choiseul", Tuileries gardens and so much more. There is also a great market and street of restaurants just behind the hotel and a Monoprix (supermarket)down the road. Most Parisian hotel rooms are tiny, but this is hotel offers spacious rooms and fabulous bathrooms with excellent quality toiletries. For me, the best thing is the comfortable bed and glorious pillows. It is not a budget choice, but very good value because you actually get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in a great location with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: treasureParis
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Friday. The room was stylishly decorated, bathroom small but modern. We requested a balcony overlooking the avenue de l'opera and got one - wow! Met our son who was staying in a hostel with friends for a drink in the bar and it was a hip and happening place. We had a very nice dinner in the restaurant and thought what a great hotel. Saturday and Sunday the restaurant was closed!!??!! My son wanted to check into the hotel for the Sunday night and even though they knew we were already guests of the hotel they would not budge on a very exprensive rate, so he went back to his hostel and booked a room online with booking.com at a much cheaper rate. When he arrived at the hotel on Sunday he tried to order a club sandwich from the room service menu. The kitchen could not make one. He chose something else and they didn't have that either so he went elsewhere. We had breakfast on two mornings. The first morning a mature woman organised an "express breakfast" and we received it promptly. The second morning a young waitress didn't know what service was. The buffet wasn't replenished and at times no staff were in the breakfast room. On sunday night we asked the staff at the front desk to recommend a restaurant (shops and many restaurants are closed on a Sunday in Paris) and we walked to the one they recommended only to find it was closed on a Sunday. If the hotel is not going to open its own restaurant then they should at least know what is open in the area. This hotel has the perfect location and beautiful rooms. The bar and restaurant are good when they are open. Service on a weekend needs to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good size room”
Reviews.Author: travelermundo
Reviews.Content: I met my friend in Paris for a three days stay as he was already here for a week for work. the hotel itself is in a prime location directly within a shot-eye and walking distance to the Opera House. for those of you (like me) who have to have your Starbucks, there is one conveniently a block away. Now the room we are is an upgrade from a standard room to a Jr. Suite with 2 twin beds AND a balcony with views of the Opera House. The room is fairly large for European standards. The toilet is separated from the shower, adding privacy and ease of use shower facilities. We ordered room service late one night (11pm) and it was terrible. I ordered a Penne Bolognaise and it was cold and tasted pre-heated. My friend had a Chicken Club with bacon sandwich and it was pretty good. His sandwich was better than my dish, which i didn't eat. Even though the room menu states that all dishes are available 24/24, that wasn't the case when i ordered the grilled beef dish but was told the Chef was gone for the night and that i would have to select another dish. Other than the room service snafu, the service is great and the staff very attentive and helpful. A nice treat for a mid-week getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Restaurant Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: Parisiennessence
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions, and have always found the hotel itself to be perfect. The location is excellent, and the rooms are scrupulously clean, spacious and elegant. The hotel staff, i.e. front desk, concierge etc are amazing, and always go out of their way to be helpful. Sadly, when it comes to the restaurant it is like another world. Whilst the food at breakfast is perfectly adequate, the staff are not welcoming and very distant. At night the food in the restaurant is nowhere near as good as other restaurants in the vicinity. Like a pevious reviewer I hope Hotel Management reads this review as the restaurant and its staff are distracting from what is otherwise a faultless hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for short break.”
Reviews.Author: BogdanSavin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and the reception and concierge people are very pleasant. No doubt about this. I can' t say the same about the service in the restaurant. They are from a different world and I mean they are not prepared for their job. We got only breakfast and fifteen minutes before closing they haven't serve omlette and most of the plates were empty. I thought we are serving the cook and not vice versa. Anyway I got an omlette next day; no taste. Maybe the management will read this and improve.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: We have try the restaurant of the hotel , nice location just nearby the Museum the Louvre and place of the Opera ; the design of the restaurant is nice and original the wine list was quiet full of possibility We recommend the Fish "The cardine" it was the first time for us ; it's seems that the Cardine it's a french fish from Bretagne the staff was helpfull and very nice with us . but the best was the desert so sweat the Cheescake home made you've loved IT !!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncm1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed only a single night at this hotel, however, based upon this limited experience, it seemed that the concierge staff were very friendly, well informed and could not be faulted in their delivery. The room we had was pleasingly decorated (not a typical anonymous hotel room) with a comfy bed and great en-suite facilities (again, not simply the normal anonymous hotel bathroom). We did not look over the Ave. de Opera, however, this certainly made for the room to be quiet. If I had one criticism, it would be the charge for breakfast, 25eu/person, which for a continental breakfast seemed over the top. This did not however detract from a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Location in a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is briliantly located on the Avenue de la Opera. We stayed there for a week in September 2011. . From our room (603) we could step onto a small balcony. Look to the left and The Paris Opera House is right there..(about three blocks down). Look to the right and the Louvre is there, perhaps 8-10 blocks down. The concierge staff are all first class! Each is extremely helpful and passionate about helping us experience the best of Paris. Special thanks to Billy, Franceso, Moussa, and Renau. The hotel is stylishly decorated. Our room - a Deluxe - was a bit small, but certainly comfortable enough for two people. We had to ask for a kettle, and then had to supply our our own tea, milk and sugar. The pillows on our king bed were also king sized...they seem to be the type that would usually be used for decoration on a large bed. Made sleeping more difficult than it should be. In fairness though, I didn't ask for smaller pillows, which might well have been available. Our package at 290 Euro's included breakfast and in room internet for the week. Quite good value given Paris prices! Breakfast was adequate, though the staff were dramatically different from the Concierge team. Although we ate there every morning for seven mornings, it was like being a stranger each time. Rarely a smile, and food that was depleted wasn't replenished in a timely way. For example, I regularly had to ask for either the skim milk or the cereal to be re-stocked. Would I stay again? Yes...for the location, the very helpful desk staff and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Glamour and style and location! Fuctionality - not so much.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRoamer
Reviews.Content: This was the first opportunity to see the newly renovated Hotel Edward VII since it was acquired by new owners in 2008. Visually, it has been dramatically re-done, with all the glamour and style that one could expect for this fashionable neighborhood in central Paris. The location can't be beat. The staff are all different, but unfailingly friendly and helpful (well, except for the housekeeper who walked into my room late one morning and scolded me for not putting the "service" sign on the door handle to notify her). The room had a few drawbacks in terms of functionality: the small table that was the closest thing to a desk had a lamp and a phone on it - but only one electrical outlet on that wall, so you had to choose, lamp or phone but not both. The "king" bed was two twin beds with separate foundations pushed alongside one another - on the elegant hardwood floor, they quickly slid apart so there was no option to sleep in the middle, only one side or the other. A humorous moment occurred when a printed notice was delivered on Sunday announcing that there would be sirens and emergency drills for staff upcoming on the Monday - and, in English, that the drills would be occurring the preceding Friday! Ah, well, not easy to manage a small hotel! But it's really elegant, if pricey due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lovemelbourne83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel in August. The Staff were very friendly and helpful, especially as we had arrived on an early flight from Australia and we were able to access our room in the morning. The Hotel is in a great location, close to restaurants, bus tour of the city and other attractions. The room was lovely, clean and modern, overlooking L'Opera Avenue. The staff made us feel very welcome including the General Manager.Would definately recommend and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location - shame about the bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pat195173
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the above hotel, on balance the hotel was well located, the staff were very efficient and helpful, the breakfast adequate. We booked a standard double room and whilst the room itself was a bit on the small side - it was to the front of the hotel, had a nice view from the balcony of the Opera Garnier but the bed was tiny - it was a very small double (around 4 ft wide!!) the first night proved very uncomfortable and the next morning we asked to be moved. Only to be told the hotel was full and this was not possible - so we had to endure another two nights in this tiny bed - I was so glad when I reached the Travelodge in London where the beds are king size.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: suzynwc
Reviews.Content: What a delight this hotel was. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite (due to a mix up with our travel agent) and I'm now spoilt for life! The decor was sumptuous and rich, beautiful fabrics & textures - and when I glanced into the 'regular' rooms as they were being serviced I saw that they were decorated to the same high standard. The reception staff & concierge were all delightful & charming with cheery greetings whenever we walked through the hotel. Although we didn't have dinner in the hotel restaurant, the breakfasts were good - the usual breads & pastries, cheeses & cooked meats, fruits & cereals, there was also a hot selection of bacon, scrambled eggs etc, with the best freshly squeezed juices I've ever had! The location is superb, I shan't list all the places within walking distance, just trust me, we didn't need to use the metro at all. We spent three very, very comfortable nights here & I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveler777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights out of a 3 week European vacation and this was absolutely the best hotel we stayed at. The staff was VERY attentive. We had a deluxe room facing the Opera with a balcony on the 4th floor. It was a little noisy, but then again it is on a pretty busy street. The location is great. You can walk to many places and the tour bus stop is nearby. There are many great bistros nearby and the shopping galleries LaFayette and Printemps. If you have a chance, take a tour of the Opera Garnier just up the street. It is fabulous! I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “this is definitely a finest hotel in Paris in every detail! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: hitoridemo3
Reviews.Content: I have had not so pleasant experience with hotels in Paris, and honestly, I was'nt sure about Edouard VII when I made my reservation. But my worries were quickly washed away. I can write so many nice things about this hotel, but almost nothing negative. The staffs were warm, disciplined, dedicated, and they had pride in taking care of their guests. We stayed in a suite, which was a beautiful room and very very clean. There was a box of Pierre Herme's macarons waiting for us in the room. We had a balcony with an awesome view of the Opera house. Eventhough the hotel is located on a very busy street, once you close the windows, it is so quiet that you forget where you are. In the room, I never heard our neighbors, nor voices from the corridor. I believe that the building is classic, but the interiors are updated and very comfortable. Hot water and running water was great, and I liked the bathrobe and luxury slippers. I had wi-fi service in my room and was walking around with my IPAD. I stayed for 6 nights, and my first 2 nights were on business, followed by a vacation welcoming my mother and daughter. Edouard VII is a great hotel for both business and holiday purposes. The location is so convenient. You can walk to Louvre museum, to rue St. Honore where the luxury boutiques are, and to Gallerie Lafayette and Printemps. Its also walking distance to Concorde, Vendome, and Champ Elysees. Metro station is just minutes away, and you have easy access to two stations, Pyramides and Opera. Our accomadation came with breakfast, so we ate at the dining room every morning. The buffet were same, but it tasted great and we never got tired. We could have had breakfast in our room, but we preferred to enjoy the nice ambience of the dining room downstairs. If you are searching to find a nice hotel in Paris that will make your trip most enjoyable and relaxing, I would definitely recommend Edouard VII. I have met with the general manager who is a beautiful and wonderful lady, and I could tell that fine hotels depend on the GM greatly. The only downside is the fitness room which was very small. If you need a swimming pool and hyper fitness facilities, then you may find it lacking. I myself often choose hotels with great fitness facilities, but not this time. At Edouard VII, its not an issue at all. Edouard VII is the hotel that won't let you down, and that will make your stay in Paris a memorable experience! It surely will continue to be my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VernonBirdman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights last year. The hotel is very clean and the staff are very helpful, curteous and pleasant. Our room faced rue de l"opera so it could be noisy some nights, particularly on the weekend but, in fairness, we live in a small city. On the plus side, it is very centrally located and within walking distance to the area where the tour buses depart and arrive and quite close to the Louvre. One tip...unless you have endless money to blow, skip the buffet breakfast; it is a bit of a rip off when compared to buffet's that we have purchased in other European hotels. If you have the time, take the day trips to Bruge and to Versailles. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, perfect location, and clean comfortable rooms make this the best hotel for your money!”
Reviews.Author: PMArking
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that this hotel is absolutely one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at (and I've traveled a LOT). My wife and I initially had a hard time deciding on a hotel for our trip to Paris. It was my wife's first time there and I wanted our 5 days in Paris to be a memorable occasion in the best possible hotel, but I did not want to break the bank on a hotel to the point where I wouldn't be able to afford anything once we got there! A very close friend of mine, who is a travel agent, suggested this hotel, telling me that it's by far the "best bang for your buck". I took his advice and still haven't stopped thanking him every time I talk to him! For starters, this hotel is in a perfect location. Located right next to the Opera in the heart of Paris, we were within walking distance of the Louvre, the Jardin des Tuileries, the Galeries Lafayette, and many other sites. The nearby metro, a 2-minute walk from the front door, is a central hub from which we were able to get to virtually any destination (including the airport) with zero or, at most, only one connection ("correspondance", as they call it in French). I cannot begin to account for all the Euros that we saved on taxis as a result of this hotel's convenient location! Next, the rooms: while I cannot speak for every room in the hotel (we obviously only stayed in one room for our 5-day stay), I can tell you that our room was absolutely beautiful. It was immaculately clean, loaded with amenities (a nice minibar with a useful refrigerator, a free convenient safe, several closets, high-speed wifi access, really lavish towels, soaps, creams, and other bathroom amenities, and, best of all, one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in. (In fact, my wife and I had trouble getting up every morning to see Paris because of how great those pillows and blankets were!) And, unlike every other hotel, whose rooms seem to be decorated by the same person, the Edouard 7 hotel seems to pride itself in being uniquely designed, from the colors to the patterns to the architecture. Our room was breathtakingly designed with rich colors everywhere, and the use of space, sloping ceilings, and little balconies overlooking Avenue de l'Opera really made it such a fun stay. And, I must point out that I'm not even talking about a luxury suite or anything! We stayed in a regular room. So, I can only imagine what would await someone who upgraded to a luxury suite! If I had one complaint at all, though, it was just that the wi-fi connection required a sign-on process that limited me to only one device connecting at one time, so I had to keep signing on and off to switch between my laptop and my iPhone as needed. Hopefully, they will reconsider that approach before my next visit (and yes, I do intend to stay there every time I visit Paris from now on!). But, I saved the best part for last: the service. The staff working at Edouard 7 is really dedicated to making the stay perfect. They really made us feel so welcome, and were there for every question, every request... everything. Their genuine concern for our having a memorable stay in Paris was very comforting and we relied on them for many of our "touristy" things, like getting advance tickets to the different sites to avoid long lines, which was an amazing timesaver (for example, with their help, we were able to avoid the hour-long lines at the Eiffel Tower, and were able to literally walk right into the elevator and ride up to the top). And, I have to say, that I am often the "self-reliable" type, and don't often turn to concierges for help, but in this hotel I felt very comfortable going to them any time I had any questions or needs. In short, I can't say enough about this amazing hotel and its incredibly friendly staff. As my friend told me before my trip: it is clearly the best bang for your buck, and you will actually be sad when you check out! I am already looking forward to another visit to Paris--and another stay at the Edouard 7.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect Accommodations For A First Trip To Paris”
Reviews.Author: NYYStadiumInsider
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said in all of the other reviews? Hotel Edouard 7 is a great hotel, with a perfectly central location, in an amazing city. My wife and I spent six nights at Hotel Edouard in March 2011 during our first trip to Paris. We couldn't have picked a better place to rest our heads. If you like to be surprised by the intricate details of a beautiful boutique hotel, you can stop reading here, knowing you'll have a great stay. Otherwise, I have plenty more to share! We were upgraded to one of the "Couture Collection" rooms, (No. 502) which featured a balcony overlooking Avenue de L'Opera with a stunning view of the Opera House in one direction and Hotel Du Luvre in the other direction. The room definitely had a "lovers" theme, with red velvet walls, drapes and furniture - it's very easy for this type of room to come off cheesy, but at Hotel Edouard 7 it is tastefully executed. Room 502 features a spacious layout with the main sleeping room separated from the foyer, bathroom and toilet room. The bathroom boasts modern fixtures, a heated towel rack, a beautiful soaking tub and a standing shower with a "rainshower" shower head. I'd love to give both the bath and shower glowing reviews, but it is definitely a case of form over function. For whatever reason, we all kinds of trouble getting hot water for more than one bath or shower, especially if we showered during off peak times (such as in the afternoon). I definitely took a few cold showers - unacceptable when paying a few hundred dollars per night for a hotel room. Also, the caulking for the standing shower was shoddy, causing a puddle on the bathroom floor. Finally, the heated towel rack only worked randomly and not on demand (there was a knob on the rack that was supposed to control the heat, but it didn't work). The separate room with the toilet was very small, but the toilet worked flawlessly and had a very powerful flush, so nothing to complain about there. The main sleeping room has an amazingly comfortable king-sized bed with down comforters and pillows that will make you never want to awake from your slumber. A comfortable bed is of the utmost importance in a hotel room and this one didn't disappoint. Although there is a large balcony facing the bustling Avenue de L'Opera, the doors and windows are made of extremely thick, soundproof glass which keeps out the noise. Just like the towel rack in the bathroom, the heater in the room didn't work on demand - although there was a knob that was supposed to control the room's temperature. We were lucky enough to have warm temperatures during our stay (low 60's), but at night, we could have used a bit of heat. A small table with two chairs and desk space directly under the TV were welcome additions to the room, especially since accommodations in Paris are known to be cramped. Unfortunately, there wasn't much drawer space to store clothes in. There was a large closet with ample hanging space, but non-hanging items were relegated to a couple of shelves, one of which contained mini-bar items. Speaking of the mini-bar, it is located within the aforementioned closet and because it is refrigerated, it gives off a lot of heat. At times, I was worried that there wasn't enough ventilation, but nothing burst into flames, so no complaints there. The service at this hotel is top notch. The workers are trained professionals and will bend over backwards to satisfy their guests. Raphael was especially pleasant during our stay - always greeting us with a smile, and answering any of the many questions that we had. If you're an American who is scared of visiting Paris because you heard Parisians aren't too friendly - don't be. This was some of the best service my wife and I ever received. Some random hotel notes: - The hotel has wi-fi, but in order to connect you need to request a card containing a username and password from the front desk. The wi-fi was extremely shoddy in room 502 (probably because it is on a high floor), but the speed was fine. Annoyingly, the internet connection times out after a certain amount of inactivity, which means constantly re-entering the overly long usernames and passwords. - The restaurant attached to the hotel offers a buffet breakfast for 25 Euros which isn't worth the cost of admission. The food is fine, but no breakfast is worth that much money. - The hotel's elevator is extremely small and fits at most 3-4 people. If you're claustrophobic, you might want to request a room on a lower floor so you can take the stairs. Overall, this is a great hotel and one that we'd return to without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'd now stay at in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nickpala
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. While the price reflects its central location it is not unduly expensive and offers really good value. We stayed in a junior suite which was very comfortable and made excellent use of the limited space that all Parisian hotels have. The balcony onto the avenue de l'Opera was an unexpected treat, yet despite its main road frontage the room was incredibly quiet once the windows were shut. Bathroom facilities were outstanding for a French hotel - best hotel shower I've had for a long time. The king size bed was very comfortable - it was tempting to lie and miss all the sights. The staff were, without exception, friendly and helpful, happily booking a restaurant for us and looking after our bags after we'd checked out. I really can't recommend this hotel enough - perfect for a short trip and would be a real treat for a longer one.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for the perfect trip in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: RobynSchmitt
Reviews.Content: This trip was for my husband's 50th birthday & he had lived in Paris 20 years ago.My 6 year old daughter and I have never been to France. Therefore I was looking for the perfect location, room and view. After searching MANY hotels I kept going back to Edouard 7 Hotel. They offered 2 different styles of decorated rooms. If you like modern, then you select to stay in the Couture decor. One of my biggest disappointments were most of the other hotels all have very modern rooms. I wanted to stay in a room that felt like Paris inside too! The Edouard 7 Hotel also offered the Classic decor room! Beautifully decorated with wooden floors, chocolates and canolope colors, a towel warmer in the bathroom (along with a tub AND shower!). BUT the view....I had a balcony that looked down at one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen, the Opera House! In addition, the hotel lobby, restaurant and bar are decorated with an unique style. If you have an appreciation for interior design and creativity then you will love it. The restaurant in the hotel is amazing! The breakfasts were amazing from their fresh baked croissants, fresh squeezed juices to their dinner menu and desserts! If this wasn't enough I have to add the iciing on the cake. The staff was amazing. Everyone was very accomadating, friendly and personable. We befriended several of them. They made our trip perfect. I highly recommend staying at the hotel. We walked every where in Paris and I was really glad we stayed at the Edouard 7 Hotel. The location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: esbe59
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for main tourist sights, within walking distance of Louvre & Pompidou Centre. Staff were friendly and helpful. Boutique decor great (even in standard room). As our room was 1st floor at the front of the hotel, we were worried that we may be kept awake by road noise, but the double glazing was very effective. Breakfast was good. Many restaurants close by at the Opera. Very close to Harry's Bar. Would definately revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Lurvely!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lopen365
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this week on business and I thought I just had to write and say how lucky I was to stay!!!! The room was massive for a Parisien hotel, I am used to staying in a box when in Paris so was more than pleased when I opened the door! Nice and modern with a boutique feel. All my collegueas had good size rooms too. The staff were very attentive and friendly. Overall a very pleasant couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Doych
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our 3 young children to Paris for the weekend to celebrate our 5 year olds birthday. In the best of situations, it is difficult to travel with the children. But, going to Paris, I assumed would be a nightmare. I was expecting the usual snotty service and intolerance of children. This was not the case at Edouard 7. The concierge was extremely helpful. He booked us a birthday dinner at a lovely bistro that was fantastic. The waiters were wonderful to the children and he had organized a cake with a candle for after dinner. The staff at Edouard were perfect. Everyone was helpful and polite. The breakfast was really good and fresh. Our suite was large by Parisian standards. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would return”
Reviews.Author: Seattle98101
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night here on a business trip, but was favorably impressed. It feels like an elegant boutique hotel, in a great location right on Opera Avenue. Around the back side of the hotel is a square with about 8-10 different restaurants, very convenient if you want to grab a quick bite nearby (or sit & relax in a cozy atmosphere). The hotel rooms were typically small, but well-appointed, with a comfortable bed and beautiful bathroom. I was able to get a quick continental breakfast (juice, croissant & cappuccino) for 10 euro rather than taking a full breakfast. I also really appreciated that there was free access to a PC & printer in a sitting room off the lobby, making it easy to check a map or print a boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheRockmans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Edouard 7. We had read great reviews on Trip Advisor, and the hotel lived up to our expectations. It's a small hotel, so not much in the way of amenities, but that didn't bother us. The staff at the hotel were fantastic. They were friendly, helpful and couldn't do enough for us. We booked a deluxe room on the 5ht floor, which was spacious (by Paris standards), with a fun view of the Opera and a trendy purple interior. (I'm not sure the rooms on floors 1 to 4 are as nice, so might be worth trying to get the 5th or perhaps the 6th floors). The room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom had a great shower. The hotel's location on the Avenue de L'Opera was within walking distance of the Louvre, the Concord, the big department stores and many high end shops. Overall I would rate this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great room, excellent personal service and very good location”
Reviews.Author: phill1973
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Edouard VII (through Eurostar + Hotel) as a 30th birthday treat for my fiance. I booked a deluxe room which was pretty amazing, I was given the choice of decor and opted for couture (very French!) The service from all at the hotel was fantastic, everyone very attentive and helpful. Location is great, easy to get to from Gard de Nord on the metro and lots of major attractions within walking distance (The Louvre just 5 mins walk down the road from the hotel) We only had Saturday and Sunday in Paris so stayed just one night. Food and drinks in the hotel are expensive (as we found generally in Paris) but we did treat ourselves to some lovely cocktails in the hotel bar. The upshot is my fiance was very happy and we had a great stay at this hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for many reasons”
Reviews.Author: Nancy800
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the Opera House and Louvre. Larger room than we anticipated in Paris. Stylish, immaculate and modern. But the most outstanding item was the staff. Couldn't be more accommodating, pleasant, willing to help with anything. (Late night, early morning, adaptors, room service, etc.) Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff / Great Loaction”
Reviews.Author: Parisiennessence
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before and we loved the staff/hotel/location so much that we returned again this year on 2 separate occasions in September and October. The location is terrific, being close to the Opera House, the Louvre and 2 Metro stations. On both occasions we were upgraded to deluxe Couture style rooms which are quite spectacular and opulent. Both times the rooms faced onto the Avenue Opera and we had no issues whatsoever with traffic noise as the soundproofing was excellent. However it is the staff which make this hotel such a total standout. Everyone was always so friendly, courteous, attentive and professional at all times. In particular, Peter,Julia, Francesco, Mussa and Billy always represented themselves and the hotel with outstanding professionalism. The recent protests in France could have caused us some problems regarding transfers to the train station and the airport but the staff handled our concerns with efficiency, attention and good humour.

Reviews.Title: “How hotel service should be.”
Reviews.Author: Persika
Reviews.Content: My wife, 6month old son and myself stayed in this hotel during the last day of our trip to France. We were a little tired after a week of travelling and excited to be back in Paris. The location of this hotel is amazing. Right on Rue Opera and just a few blocks away from Garnier. But more importantly, it was the phenomenal service that the staff provided that impressed me. Upon arrival, we had been upgraded to a suite with views of Garnier and every amenity one could wish for. The staff were incredibly helpful with our 6month old. The room was very well organized. This will be our hotel of choice in Paris from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: aphrodite01
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at E7 five times - four times when it was family owned and once since the new ownership. We had always loved the hotel and were a little worried it might be spoilt by a modern corporate styling. I am happy to say we were very wrong. The makeover has been done with style and the staff are great (only Christophe, the superb concierge, remains from the old regime) and they always smile and greet you as you pass and make you feel really welcome. Cathy Lammens, the front office manager, leads a great team. On previous stays we had twice been upgraded to a suite (wonderful experience) and although this time we were not we still felt our room was lovely with a large, totally new, bathroom. We always opt for a room facing the Avenue de l'Opera as the view is so great and you soon get used to the traffic. We celebrated our wedding anniversary whilst we were there this year and were surprised with a bottle of champagne (good quality) and a card sending the staff's congratulations. It is not cheap to stay here but I personally don't begrudge paying when the service is so good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris and Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: TheRendons
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed hered for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It is in a good location, being next to the Opera House. The Louvre is a short walk away and its easy to hop on a metro or bus to get to other areas. The rooms are small, like all Paris hotels, but we found it to be clean and well-kept. We had a room on the back side f the building so it was very quiet. It also had a nice little balcony looking out over the street. The bedding is kind of pornish (Purple velvet), but the beds are super comfortable. Great room for recovering from jet lag...

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: dtj2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel boutiqe style. Great location Opera and Louve within walking distance.The best cocierge staff go above and beyond. Stayed in a suite large even for american standards. highly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: willy b
Reviews.Content: it is a fine hotel, very near all the shopping areas and the opera. the service is very good and the american breakfeast is very good. the room I had was rather small but it was also the cheappest, so it was wel worth the price. the only thing is that the isolation of the room is very poor, so you can hear olmost everyting of the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and location - uneven accomodations”
Reviews.Author: travelquick
Reviews.Content: Assets of Edouard VII are its people and, of course, location (proximity to the Opera, Louvre, Place Vendome and the big department stores). On the other hand, the hotel suffers from the typical Paris problem: it's overpriced for the room quality it offers. I used a supposedly "double" room for single use, but the room size was a mere single by three-star standards. Bathroom was tiny (I'm not sure a really tall person would be OK in there), but indeed brand new and cleverly set, with bathrobes and good quality toiletries.The rooms that looked really double by 4*standards were classified as "superior" and priced around 60% higher. Breakfast and room service was in my view overpriced, too. Another problem is some noise in the rooms overlooking Av.Opera; back rooms are therefore more demanded and harder to find. I have not enough to say for the staff, they are really helpful, they are ready and competent to assist in anything needed and they offer to do much more than one would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, but uneven accommodations”
Reviews.Author: CharlesV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Édouard VII on business trips on a few occasions, always in a different room type. Some are more comfortable than others. Avenue de l'Opéra being quite a noisy thoroughfare, rooms facing the back street provide for much better sleep. Service has always been extremely courteous and helpful, even going way beyond the call of duty in one particular instance recently. I have only high praises for the staff. Rooms are uneven in style and quality. Book carefully. All have superior bathrooms though. What they have on the room service menu is very good but the selections are too limited for a hotel of this class. The concierge will, however, provide excellent recommendations for restaurants and take care of reservations for us. On my last visit, I haven't been able to get the Wi-Fi to work even with the proper access codes. I'm assuming that will have been fixed by now. All in all, a nice hotel in a great location, walking distance from the Louvres, Place Vendôme, Place de la Concorde, and the Jardin des Tuileries. Would definitely consider it for a holiday in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Classy in Paris, good value”
Reviews.Author: farfar
Reviews.Content: It looks better than the photos show. There is something in that atmosphere, same time is classic and traditional but cosy and modern. Junior suite is great, only problem is bed are not too comfortable, but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slava74
Reviews.Content: Despite of I liked this hotel, I did not have an impression to be in 4* hotel. The “standard room” is nicely decorated, but tiny (it was much smaller then at official photos) and with bad acoustic insulation. The hot dished on breakfast were very simplified and 1st-price jambon was not really eatable. Do not even imagine facilities like pool/gym, but they can propose an ironing service (and no way of cause to have an iron for free). Poor return on money (if public price).

Reviews.Title: “This was a beautiful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mfennell
Reviews.Content: Every employee that we came in contact with, asked recommendations from or gave us directions was positively spot on and uber helpful! One night Chris (great employee)even walked us to the restaurant that we were eating in and invited us to his gym to work out. I can not speak highly enough of the staff! The location was perfect as well, next to the Metro and a short walk to the Louvre. I will say that we initially got one of their junior suites which was contemporary and very well appointed, we however switched to a more "frenchy" older suite because that was the experieince that we were looking for. One night being jet lagged (or having too much wine) probably the latter I left the safe open with all of our wordly possessions and I am happy to say that not a single thing was touched. I will say that we will return the next time we are in Paris:)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but a great experience”
Reviews.Author: LaurieCSSLO
Reviews.Content: Paris was having very hot weather when we were there, but the hotel room had good and quiet air conditioning. The room was very attractive, quiet, and comfortable, with a small balcony from which we could see the Opera Garnier. Service was very good. The location was excellent. The beds were extremely comfortable, robes and slippers were provided, turn-down service, helpful and friendly concierge and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - lovely and convenient”
Reviews.Author: theinphillips
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem - the staff are courteous and helpful, the rooms are lovely and immaculate (if a bit small - to be expected), and the location could not be better. As others have said, it is on quite a busy road, but the room itself was very quiet. It really was a pleasure to be in the room after a long day of walking around Paris. We will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mpeopl678
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edouard VII in Paris for pleasure. It is right by the Opera and near wonderful department stores for easy shopping. The included buffet breakfast was excellent with cold meats, cheese, exotic fruits, lovely pastries, delicious coffee and boiled eggs. The room was nicely appointed but of course was on the small size. The balcony was teeny tiny. The marble bathroom was updated and very nice but again very small which is typical for a hotel of this age albeit recently renovated. I have no complaints about this nice hotel property and would gladly return for a romantic getaway or business trip to Paris, France.

Reviews.Title: “Exhilarating Vacation !”
Reviews.Author: TrinidadEurolover
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and in laws for 3 days in December 2008. We decided to visit Paris while our main vacation was in London. Absolutley no regrets! The hotel was indeed elegantly decorated, with well appointed rooms and a decent sized bath room. Excellent location! So many wonderful cafes and shopping within a very short distance. My wife and I walked and explored the side street cafes and shops. The concierge, Christopher was just the best! From the moment we arrived at the doors of the Edouard, he offered a warm smile and familiar sense of humor which quickly shook off the chilly winter temperatures in December! Christopher singly organized tours, dinners and even personally walked us to a nearby cafe for our first lunch, all being very unfamiliar territory as first timers in Paris - what a gem of a guy! We are keeping our fingers crossed that we would return this Xmas (09)! Would be staying here again! If ever you are planning to have a first visit or return to Paris, treat yourself to excellent Parisian hospitality and an overall unforgettable experience. Well worth the price... -Jason & the Smith family from sunny Trinidad, W.I.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back”
Reviews.Author: PederOsloNorway
Reviews.Content: 8 friends thought we had found a reasonable hotel in Paris worth the extra euros we paid. How wrong we were. Location is ok, but noise level is to high, prices are to high for this quality, breakfast is to expensive and waiters in the breakfastroom are more concerned about charging you than refilling the breakfast-table. Think about this; only 1-one salt and pepper in the dining room which again means the waiters have to spend unneccesary time running these around. Service in the lobby is ok, but when you are told that you get a room with window away from the main street, you would think so happened. It did not. Very disappointing! Fitnesscenter lacks upgrade to todays standards, belt on treadmill stops intermittently when you are trying to run and there are no free weights. Barservice only ok and very expensive. Some of the rooms we got were very tiny (ours was ok) and one even got a small double bed.... We didn´t ask for that. Overall experience not good and we will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: 79Rome
Reviews.Content: Quaint and cozy. Nothing like the big Hotel chains. Charming and hidden. a jem a couple of blocks from the Louvre and within easy walking distance to everywhere. Great Junior suite room , king-size bed and outstanding breakfast. Staff was extremely helpful, nice and friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Edouard 7
HotelInfo.Address: 39 Avenue de L'Opera, 75002 Paris, France
